newsitem.title: JAPAN: SOCCER-JAPAN HEAD FOR PLACE IN FINAL ASIAN ROUND.
newsitem.headline: SOCCER-JAPAN HEAD FOR PLACE IN FINAL ASIAN ROUND.

text.p: Barring an unlikely 10-goal defeat in their last first-round match, Japan clinched a place in the final round of the Asian qualifying competition for next year's World Cup finals when they beat Nepal 3-0 on Wednesday.
Two goals from striker Kazuyoshi Miura and one from Akinori Nishizawa gave Japan their fifth successive group four victory to take them on to a maximum 15 points and a goal tally of 30-0.
The only factor that would stop their progress would be a highly-unlikely defeat by 10 or more goals to second-placed Oman in their final qualifier on Saturday.
Oman, who beat Macao 2-0 on Wednesday, have 12 points from five matches and a goal tally of 13-1. Their only defeat was a 1-0 loss to Japan.

Nishizawa set Japan on their way to victory when he scored just before halftime, knocking in a rebound after a goalmouth scramble. Japan had to wait until the 73rd minute to increase their lead when Miura, who scored six goals in Sunday's game against Macao, curled in a free kick from outside the penalty area.
In the 87th minute, Miura scored a second, his 50th goal for Japan.
Oman kept alive the faintest of mathematical possibilities of reaching the final round with their 2-0 win over Macao, who have twice been beaten 10-0 by Japan during the series.
Mohamed Al Araimi and Ahmed Ali Hassan scored a goal each towards the end of each half respectively after Macao defender Iong Kin Chong was sent off for violent play after just 12 minutes.
Only the group winner will advance to the 10-nation final round to be held in late October and early November for three berths in next year's World Cup finals in France.
Asia's fourth-place finisher will move to a playoff match with the Oceania zone winner, either Australia or New Zealand, for a possible fourth berth in the finals.
